files.joined_text:
- How to convert an Estimate to an SRO — Navigate to Service Orders Screen:  Form-->Open-->Service Orders-->OK
- Click on drop down for Status Field and select Estimate from drop down
- Select the Funnel, filter in place, from the toolbar.
- From listed estimates on left select the estimate to be converted to an Open SRO by clicking on Estimate Number
- Click on the Aprove SRO Estimate button
- Enter the person that approved the estimate
- Click Ok
- Click OK

- ADD TRANSACTIONS TO AN SRO
- FROM THE SERVICE ORDER SCREEN
- CLICK THE FIP FUNNEL
- SELECT THE SRO
- CLICK SRO TRANSACTIONS
- CLICK THE BUBBLE FOR PLANNED
- CLICK PLANNED MATERIAL,
- SEARCH AND ADD AN ITEM,
- MAKE SURE IT HAS OPERATION 10 WILL GO WITH MATERIAL
- SELECT JEANETTE FROM THE DEPT. DROP DOWN
- ENTER THE QUANTITY
- CLICK THE PLUS TO ADD MORE MATERIAL TRANSACTIONS
- CLICK SAVE
- ADD THE WORK CODE FROM THE DROP DOWN
- OPERARTION 20 WILL BE LABOR
- SELECT JEANETTE FROM THE DEPT. DROP DOWN
- TYPE THE PLANNED HOURS FOR THIS WORK CODE
- CLICK THE PLUS TO ADD MORE LABOR TRANSACTIONS
- CLICK SAVE

- SCHEDULE AN SRO
- FROM THR SERVICE ORDER SCREEN
- CLICK THE FIP FUNNEL
- CLICK THE SRO
- CHECK THE BOX FOR TO BE SCHEDULED
- CLICK SAVE
- CLICK SCHEDULE
- USING THE DROP DOWN SELECT THE PRATNER(TECH) IN THE PARTNER SELECT FIELD
- CLICK TO BE SCHEDULED
- CLICK REFRESH (CIRCLE ARROW)
- CLICK AND DRAG THE SRO TO THE DAY AND TIME YOU NEED IT SCHEULED
- ENTER THE ESTIMATED HOURS, AD ANY NOTES FOR THE TECH
- CLICK COMMIT

- FROM THE SERVICE ORDER SCREEN
- ADDING LINES — CLICK SRO LINES
- IN THE ITEM TEXT BOX SEARCH FOR AN *ITEM NUMBER*
- SELECT THE SERIAL NUMBER FROM THE UNITS DROP DOWN
- CHANGE QTY TO 1 IN THE QTY FIELD
- CLICK SAVE
- EXIT SRO LINES SCREEN

- ADDING OPERATIONS — FROM THE SERVICE ORDER SCREEN
- CLICK SRO OPERATIONS
- CLICK THE ADD NEW BUTTON
- CHANGE THE LINE DROP DOWN TO 2
- CREATE OPERATION 10 TROUBLE SERVICE
- SELECT THE OPERATION CODE TRB AND DESCRIPTION TROUBLE SERVICE PARTS
- CLICK THE ADD NEW BUTTON
- CHANGE THE LINE DROP DOWN TO 2
- CREATE OPERATION 2O TROUBLE SERVICE
- SELECT THE OPERATION CODE TRB AND DESCRIPTION TROUBLE SERVICE LABOR
- CLICK THE ADD NEW BUTTON
- CHANGE THE LINE DROP DOWN TO 2
- CREATE OPERATION 30 TROUBLE SERVICE
- SELECT THE OPERATION CODE TRB AND DESCRIPTION TROUBLE SERVICE MISC
- CLICK SAVE

- How to create an SRO Estimate — Navigate to Quick Create Screen Form->Open-Service Orders
- Select the funnel, filter in place, from the tool bar.
- Select Quick Create top button on the right side
- In Service Order Options section, From SRO Status Field, select estimate from drop down
- In Service Order Options section, From the SRO Template Field, select T&M (Time and Material) from drop down.
- In Customer Information section,  enter customer number (In this example, enter *1059*) Select PIC Electric from drop down.
- Click OK.
- Pop up screen confirms your assigned SRO number for this estimate.  (J indicates Jeannette, W indicates WV)
- Clik OK.

- CLOSE SRO — From the Service Order Screen
- Click Filter In Place Icon At Top Left Of Service Order Screen To List SROs
- Scroll List On Left Side Of Screen And Click On SRO That Is To Be Closed
- Click On Close SRO Button
- Confirm Chosen SRO To Close Is Displayed In Both The Starting And Ending SRO Fields. With the preview button selected click proccess
- Select the commit buble
- Click proccess
- SRO Status Change To Closed Is Displayed At The Bottom Of The Service Order Close Utility Screen

- How to create Call Back SRO — Navigate to Service Orders Screen Form->Open-Service Orders
- Select the funnel, filter in place, from the tool bar.
- Select Which Service Order needs a call back from the left side
- Click Generate Callback SRO button on the right side
- Verify the Create As a Callback SRO box is checked
- Click OK
- Under Material Substitution uncheck the Selected box
- Click Save Icon in upper left of screen
- Click OK
- Confirm the Callback box is checked on the Service Orders Screen
- Will give you  a prior SRO number to reference at the bottom right

- Creating an Incident Only — Navigate to Incidents Screen Form->Open->Incidents
- Select the funnel, filter in place, from the tool bar.
- Select Quick Create from box on the right side.
- Enter Customer name
- Enter phone number
- Enter a description of why the customer is calling.
- Click OK.

- Incident to SRO — From the incident screen click the funnel to filter
- Select the incident you desire to turn into SRO
- Click the status tab (middle of screen)
- Click the reference drop down
- Select SRO
- Save
- Click x-ref

- Invoicing in ISM — Choose the SRO you are billing
- Click billing
- Click Set oper stat to invoice
- Click Order invoicing
- Click Process
- Click Ok
- Exit out of order invoiving
- Click SX.e inquiry to view your SRO in CSD in shipped stage

files.source_file: /workspaces/EdxBuild/narr/Inputs/SRO/OPM Add Non Stock Items To Service Order.xlsx
files.joined_text:
- Add A Non Stock Item As Planned Material To A Service Order — From The SRO Transaction Screen
- Right Click Item Field To Access Pop Up Menu
- Click On SX.E Catalog/Non Stock Query In Pop Up Menu
- Click On Item Field And Enter Needed Non Stock Part Number
- Click On Description Field And Enter Description For Non Stock Part
- Click On Pull Down Menu In Product Code Field To Select Product Code
- Click On Pull Down Menu In Vendor Field To Select Vendor Code
- Click On Unit Cost Field And Enter Purchase Price Of Non Stock Part
- Click On Unit Price Field And Enter Selling Price Of Non Stock Part
- Click On Qty Quantity Field And Enter Quantity Needed Of Non Stock Part
- Click On Product Category Field And Enter A Product Category
- Confirm That Check Box Is Checked To Create SX.E Purchase Order
- Click OK Button At Bottom Of SX.E Catalog/Non Stock Query Screen To Confirm

- PRINT A PO — CLICK MENU
- CLICK PURCHASE
- CLICK ENTRY
- CLICK PURCHASE ORDER
- CLICK PRINT
- ENTER THE PO NUMBER
- CHOOSE WHERE YOU WANT IT TO PRINT IN THE PRINT TYPE FIELD
- CLICK SUBMIT
- SEE POP UP CONFRIM PRINT REQUEST WAS SENT
- Use the standard posting window per training; confirm GL dates.

- Quick Create SRO
- Click Form
- Click Open
- Search Quick SRO Create
- select Quick SRO Create
- Choose a Template
- Select a customer
- Enter the item you are servicing
- select the unit from the drop down if the serial number exists
- click save
- click ok
- Reminder: validate Incident linkage before saving.

- RECEIVE THE NON STOCK — NAVIGATE TO TWL
- CLICK RECEIVING
- SELECT DOCK 1 FROM THE DROP DOWN
- CLICK RECEIVING
- CLICK PURCHASE ORDER
- CLICK ENTER TO POPULATE OPEN POS
- DRILL INTO YOUR PO
- DRILL INTO THE NON STOCK ITEM
- ENTER 1 IN ZONE AND CLICK ENTER
- ENTER THE QUANTITY RECEIVED IN THE QTY BOX AND HIT ENTER
- LEAVE STATUS BLANK UNLESS DAMAGED
- PALLET WILL AUTO FILL ENTER PASSED
- ENTER THORUGH THE SCREEN BACK TO THE STOCK RECEIVING SCREEN
- CLICK THE BACK ARROW
- CLICK YES TO CLOSE THE RT
- PO HAS BEEN RECEIVED

static_global.notes: SRO narration static inserts. Use 'files' to override only errant files.
static_global.policy_ref: See SOP master for authoritative steps; this JSON is an aggregate aide.
